title: Top 4 Picks For Project Management Tools For the Modern Workplace
text:
Top 4 Picks For Project Management Tools For the Modern Workplace Use your key for the next article Project Management Tools http://www.nutcache.com 
Product innovation and technology have transformed project management . Competition is fierce. It is essential for companies to provide services that are beneficial to their customers. They need to integrate marketing tactics and tools , offer logistical operations that run smoothly, and involve communication strategies. 
There are many personal project management tools that can help you to remain organized and prepared at all instances.To help you with your tasks, we have rounded up on 4 best personal project management tools . The tools featured in this article are believed to deliver what project managers need. 
1. NutCache 
NutCache is a time management and invoicing app that small businesses and freelancers find beneficial. It is a multilingual application that allows the creation of an unlimited number of estimates and invoices via the internet. All documents can be configured to have the user’s logo used. 
A Time Logger app allows the user to track time and include the data in invoices. Apple’s App Store and Google Play have access to the app. The app is available for Android and IOS devices. Notes can be added to time entries. The information can be linked to various tasks and projects. A smartphone does not have to be turned on for the app to run and record time. Documents can be attached to expenses, estimates, and bills. 
There are two versions of NutCache, a free online version and a pro version that is very reasonably priced . Bother versions allow an unlimited number of transactions. The app provides a quality invoice experience. The invoices and estimates are professional in appearance.With the app users can: 
• Access all companies whose access they possess 
• Add notes to time entries 
• Link time to projects and tasks 
• Pause and resume interaction 
• View activity from the last 30 days. 
Multiuser collaboration is allowed. The account never expires . It is a simple method of logging hours spent on a project and billing clients accordingly. The NutCache app can be used anywhere . More than 20 flexible and comprehensive reports are accessible that can be used to analyze business activity in real-time. 
2. Asana 
Asana puts conversations and tasks together to aid in team management of projects that do not rely heavily on email. The team is held accountable and focuses on results as projects are organized. Tasks are created and assigned. 
Commenting on progress can be done, files can be attached, and due dates tracked. More time is spent accomplishing what needs to be done. Reading and answering emails gets less attention than before. The software is free for teams that number 15 or fewer. It is available online or via IOS and Android. 
The features checklist includes: 
• Tracking of bugs, milestones, status, percent of completion, and time and expense 
• Collaboration avenue 
• Sharing of files 
• Management of ideas, issues, portfolios, requirements, resources, and tasks 
Asana is very easy to use. Clients and others are invited to collaborate in real-time, as users keep track of project progress. Emailing cannot compete with the scope, complexity, and speed of the modern workforce. Asana re-designed team communication. Tasks and conversations utilize one place. 
Everything is transparent and action ready. No one has to figure out what needs to be done, get on the right page, and find information in an email. That process is no longer efficient. More work is getting completed. Access is available from everywhere. 
3. Trello 
Anything with anyone can be organized with Trello . This software is a visually, collaborative project management solution that fits in the workflow. Post-it notes are replaced by a digital whiteboard. The format can be used to redesign a website or post regular company updates for management. It is useful for complex projects having many participants.
